MeasurementToolMetadata.Description: Borderline Evaluation of Severity over Time
MeasurementToolMetadata.Instructions: Choose the option that indicates how much the item has caused distress, relationship problems, or difficulty with getting things done over the past month.

best_1.Description: Worrying that someone important in your life is tired of you or is planning to leave you.

best_11.Description: Problems with impulsive behavior (not counting suicide attempts or injuring yourself on purpose). Examples include: over-spending, risky sexual behavior, substance abuse, reckless driving, binge eating.

best_11_other.Description: If you chose other in above question, please explain:

best_12.Description: Temper outbursts or problems with anger leading to relationship problems, physical fights, or destruction of property.

best_2.Description: Major shifts in your opinions about others such as switching from believing someone is a loyal friend or partner to believing the person is untrustworthy and hurtful.

best_3.Description: Extreme changes in how you see yourself. Shifting from feeling confident about who you are to feeling like you are evil or that you don't even exist.

best_4.Description: Severe mood swings several times a day. Minor events cause major shifts in moods.

best_5.Description: Feeling paranoid or like you are losing touch with reality.

best_9.Description: Going to extremes to try to keep someone from leaving you.

best_behaviors_negative_total.Description: Sum of the items comprising the 'behaviors negative' subscale

best_thoughts_feelings_total.Description: Sum of the items comprising the 'thoughts and feelings' subscale

best_total_score.Description: Global score comprised of the sum of the 'thoughts and feelings' and 'behaviors negative' subscales
